We had a choice between expanding paid leave to tens of millions of U.S. workers or expanding paid leave to no one. 

We chose to pass a bill that ensures millions of workers do not have to choose between their paycheck, their health, and the health of those around them.

Let's be absolutely clear: The only reason that tens of millions of U.S. workers are about to get paid sick leave is because @SpeakerPelosi and @HouseDemocrats made it a top priority.
 
GOP refused to support universal paid leave and our families don’t have time for a stalemate. https://t.co/RF3cD1tN2E

I applaud the state legislature for finding common ground on a bill that will give workers a long overdue raise and stimulate local economies across the Commonwealth. #RaiseTheWage

That is why I have led the effort in Congress to gradually increase the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour. This compromise is an important step toward giving workers a fair shot at financial security.

After more than a decade without an increase to the $7.25 minimum wage, thousands of Virginians are working long hours and still cannot provide for their families. No one working full-time in the wealthiest nation on earth should be living in poverty.
https://t.co/yuR9Uimbjw

Mrs. Johnson was a true American hero, and we were so proud to have her call Hampton Roads home. I want to send my deepest condolences to her family and friends, and to everyone who was inspired by her remarkable life and work.

While I knew Mrs. Johnson for many years, I never fully appreciated the work that she, Dorothy Vaughn, Mary Jackson, Christine Darden and the many other African American women at NASA trailblazed for so many until their untold story was revealed in @HiddenFigures.
Her work helped put the first Americans in space and send the Apollo 11 astronauts to the moon, thereby helping the United States win the Space Race.

It is with deep sadness that I learned of the passing of Katherine Johnson, a truly brilliant mathematician and pioneer. She broke down barriers as one of the few African-American women mathematicians working at the Flight Dynamics and Control Division at @NASA_Langley https://t.co/NDExCfJhiL
